Section.Catchline: Immunity from liability; limitation on testimony.

Subsection.Text: Any member of the statewide committee or a district committee who receives or investigates a complaint of an enrollee of a managed care program in accordance with the procedures and guidelines of the agency shall be immune from liability for good faith action on behalf of such an enrollee.
Except as otherwise provided by law, all other matters before the statewide committee or district committees shall be open to the public and subject to chapter 119 and s. 286.011.

Members of any state or district ombudsman committee shall not be required to testify in any court with respect to matters held to be confidential except as may be necessary to enforce ss. 641.60-641.75.
